combobox.noOptions: There are no options matching your request

personal.title: Title
personal.names: Surnames, given names (including patronymic or middle names)

property.physicalDamage: Physical damage (0 - no damage, 5 - very damaged)
property.livingConditions: Living conditions and repairability (0 - not suitable, 5 - very suitable)
property.future: Questions about your views on your future (including the future of the property in application)

values.1: Minor damage that does not affect habitability
values.2: Moderate damage that requires repair but does not make the building uninhabitable
values.3: Significant damage that makes the building partially uninhabitable
values.4: Severe damage that makes the building uninhabitable but repairable
values.5: Total destruction. The property is beyond repair

docs.urlNotAvailable: Link to the document is not available

alertHiddenInfo.title: Some data may be hidden
alertHiddenInfo.description:
Some data is hidden (e.g. personal data)

We are working to ensure that data owners can see it without restrictions

f0.title: Application for entry into the register

caseOpenedCard.title: A case for compensation has been opened

cardStartApplication.title: Apply entry into the registry
cardStartApplication.description: We will help you register the damaged property

cardFindApplication.title: Already submitted an application?
cardFindApplication.description: Enter your application, case, or document number so we can find them

form.submitButton: Search for application, case, or document
form.docNumberEmpty: Document number is missing. You need to enter the document number
form.docNumberIncorrect: Incorrect document format. The document number should be in the format "XX/XXXX/XXXXXXX"

apply-form.title: Application for entry into the register

alert.title: Your application <important>will be saved automatically</important> as a draft
alert.description:
You will be able to complete it later (for example, upload documents that are currently missing) within seven (7) days by returning to this page

The draft is not sent to the server and is stored only on your device!

givenName.description: Enter all given names (including patronymics or middle names), separated by a space, as they appear in the documents

surname.description: Enter all surnames, separated by a space or dash, that appear in the documents

preferableContactMethod.label: A convenient way to communicate
preferableContactMethod.description: If you choose "Email", we may in some exceptional cases (e.g. operational, technical errors or if you do not answer on a regular basis to your chosen method) use the telephone.

future.label: Questions about your views on your future (including the future of the property in application) (select one or more options that best reflect your situation)
future.description:
This question will help, at the point of financial compensation, to choose the best option for you, and for us to prioritize other options

This does not mean that you cannot change your decision later

options.going-to-restore-living-here: Planning to restore property (I currently live in it)
options.going-to-restore-will-be-living-here: Planning to restore property (I plan to live here permanently, but I don't live here now)
options.going-to-live-in-other-place-same-region: Planning to live in another place within the region where the property is located
options.going-to-live-in-other-region: I plan to live in another region
options.going-to-live-in-other-country: I plan to go abroad and live there
options.going-to-transfer-property: I plan to transfer property to another person (including deed of gift, sale, inheritance, etc.)

errors.required: Choose at least one of the options

selfAssessment.description:
You will need to self-assess the damaged property

This is not a final assessment, but only an auxiliary one to help us better understand the situation

physicalDamage.description:
Assess the physical damage to the property on a scale from 0 to 5, where 0 - no damage, 5 - very damaged

If you find it difficult to assess, put 0

engineeringSystems.label: Engineering systems (heating, water supply, sewage, etc.)

safety.description:
Assess the safety level of the property by marking field

If you find it difficult to assess, do not mark field

livingConditions.description:
Assess the habitability and repairability of the property on a scale from 0 to 5, where 0 - suitable, 5 - not suitable

If you find it difficult to assess, put 0

descriptionOfDamage.label: Description of damage (optional)
descriptionOfDamage.placeholder: Enter a description of the damage
descriptionOfDamage.description:
This field is not mandatory, but it will help us better understand the situation, as you know best what happened to the property

Use Ukrainian or English languages. We don't care about spelling, grammar, style, etc.

alert-no-save.title: This step is not saved to draft
alert-no-save.description:
Documents will not be saved as the draft - if you leave the page, you will need to add documents again.

Documents will be uploaded at the Confirmation (final) step

id.label: Identification documents
id.description:
Attach scanned copies (or photos) of your documents that confirm your identity.



Your given names and surnames and date of birth must be indicated on the document.

For example, passport, ID card, driver's license, residence permit, travel passport, etc.

propertyId.label: Property documents
propertyId.description:
Attach scanned copies (or photos) of documents that prove your ownership of the property.



The document must include the address of your property, your given names and surnames, and the share you own.

For example, a contact of sale, a will, a deed of gift, an extract from the real estate register, etc.

evidenceOfDamagedProperty.label: Evidence of destroyed property (optional)
evidenceOfDamagedProperty.description:
Add photos (or scanned copies of documents) that confirm the damage to your property.



Photos must be clear and show specific damage: preferably with different perspectives, zoom (closer, further) and fields of view (higher, lower)

If you add the testimony of people, more specifics are needed: where they live, when they saw the destruction, what kind of destruction, etc.



For example, photos, videos, reports on property inspection, documents on compensation for damages, testimonies of people, etc.

validation.personal: Check the correctness of the personal data
validation.damagedProperty: Check the correctness of the information about the damaged property
validation.docs: Check the correctness of the attached documents or add missing ones

personal.title: Title
personal.names: Surnames, given names (including patronymic or middle names)

damagedProperty.physicalDamage: Physical damage (0 - no damage, 5 - very damaged)
damagedProperty.livingConditions: Living conditions and repairability (0 - not suitable, 5 - very suitable)
damagedProperty.future: Questions about your views on your future (including the future of the property in application)

agreementToCollectAndProcessPersonalData.label: Consent to the collection and processing of personal data

signature.label: Signature
signature.description:
Put your signature, for example: surnames and given names in English

The signature confirms that you are familiar with all the specified data and agree that they are true

successCard.title: Application successfully created
successCard.description:
Write down the application number

You can check the status of the application by entering the number on the main page
successCard.willBeDone: The application should be completed by

errors.mustBe: Status must be one of the specified

no-document-to-moderation.title: That's all. All applications have been reviewed
no-document-to-moderation.description: Click the button below to check if new applications have appeared
